name: Lesson 1: Identifying notes on the piano and finger exercise pattern number 1
shortDescription: In this first lesson, you will learn how to identify the notes on a piano keyboard and practice your fingering technique. The video will cover topics such as the different note names, international finger numbering conventions, and hand positioning. By the end of this lesson, you will be able to play a simple five-note exercise with both hands. Whether you are a complete beginner or have some piano experience, this video is a great starting point for your piano journey.
target: Identifying the notes on a piano keyboard
Playing a simple five-note exercise with both hands
detailLearn: Naming of piano keys: Be able to identify the names of individual piano keys, including the white keys (C, D, E, F, G, A, B) and the black keys.
Relationship between notes: Understand the relationships between notes on the piano, including how to find the notes above and below a given note.
Basic finger numbering: The standard finger numbering system for the right and left hands, which is essential for playing piano.
Basic note patterns: Simple note patterns, such as the five-note pattern C-D-E-F-G.

name: Lesson 2: Identifying notes on the treble clef and finger exercise pattern number 2
shortDescription: In this second lesson, you will learn about identifying notes on the treble clef and a fingering pattern that can be used to play scales and arpeggios.
target: How to identify the notes of the major scale on the treble clef
How to play a basic fingering pattern
How to practice scales, arpeggios and improve your piano playing technique
detailLearn: Treble Clef: Understand the layout of the treble clef, including the five lines and four spaces, as well as the numbering system from 1 to 5 and A to E.
Note Names: Names of the notes on the treble clef, starting with the note G on the second line and proceeding upwards and downwards using the pattern G, A, B, C, D, E, F.
Ledger Lines: Used to represent notes above or below the five lines of the staff.

name: Lesson 3: Note duration, time signature, dotted notes, and finger exercise pattern number 3
shortDescription: Did you know that music notes have different durations and sheet music uses numbers to indicate the number of beats in a measure? In this lesson, you will learn about music notes, rhythm and how to play them.
target: Indicating number of beats in a measure

name: Lesson 4: Bass clef, repeat signs, and finger exercise pattern number 4
shortDescription: This lesson will cover how to identify the keys on the treble clef and also how to use the bass clef to play the left hand. What’s more, I will discuss the repeat sign, which tells the player to play a section of music twice.
detailLearn: How to identify the keys on the bass clef
How to understand the repeat sign
How to combine both hands to play a short piece of music
How to use a new finger exercise to strengthen your fingers

name: Lesson 5: What are intervals and tones? Learn about intervals, tones, and finger exercise pattern number 5
shortDescription: In this fifth lesson, you will learn about music intervals and octaves, including the definition of the interval between two notes and counting the number of notes between two notes.
detailLearn: How to count the number of notes within an octave

name: Lesson 6: Accidentals and finger exercise pattern number 6
shortDescription: In this sixth lesson, you will learn about three types of accidentals in music: sharps, flats, and naturals.
detailLearn: What are the sharps, the flats, the naturals?
How to read and play with accidentals

name: Lesson 7: Eighth notes and finger exercise pattern number 7
shortDescription: Have you ever been confused by the differences between quarter notes and eighth notes, or even more? So this lesson will teach you how to play various note combinations, including quarter notes, half notes, eighth notes, and sixteenth notes, in different rhythms and tempos.

name: Lesson 8: Triplets and finger exercise pattern number 8
shortDescription: You may sometimes encounter a tiny number 3 which is noted on top or beneath the notes and do not know the exact way to play these notes. In this eighth lesson, I will explain about triplets and their different types and also how to count them.

name: Lesson 9: Chords and how to form triads
shortDescription: Many of you may find it difficult to find chords, play the melody, or accompany a song. In this lesson, you will be covered about basic chord types, such as major, minor, augmented, and diminished.

name: Lesson 10: Seventh chords and how to form seventh chords
shortDescription: I hope you have firmly grasped the knowledge about chords in the previous lesson. This lesson will explain to you about various types of dominant seventh chords and also go over the fundamentals of chords you learned.
